diagnosis.score_summary: Medicube suffers from a severe split personality. The website attempts to be a sterile 'Pharmacy' (Dr. Shin), while Amazon operates as a dopamine-fueled 'Med-Spa' (Pink Jelly). This 'Pink Pharma' disconnect dilutes the clinical authority you are trying to build.

truth_1.headline: The Lab Coat vs. The Device
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW signals 'The Medical Authority' (Pharmacy). The PDP signals 'The Scientific Miracle' (Med-Spa). You are trying to be a prescription pad on your site and a luxury gadget on Amazon.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'Biomedical expert... Dr. Shin' (2/5) vs. PDP: '#1 Global Best Seller... Pair it with Booster Pro' (4/5)
truth_1.why_matters: Inconsistency in value perception confuses the wallet. The user doesn't know if they are paying for 'Biomedical Safety' or 'Viral Magic.'
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are selling a $27 cream. On WWW it looks like a daily essential; on PDP it looks like a high-tech luxury upgrade. The price point supports the 'essential' (WWW), but the hype supports the 'luxury' (PDP). You must choose: either clean up Amazon to match the serious clinical tone of the site (Option A), or upgrade the site to the 'Scientific Miracle' positioning and embrace the high-tech glamour (Option B). You cannot be both a utility and a luxury.

truth_2.headline: Sterile White vs. Electric Pink
truth_2.gap_description: WWW relies on 'Pharma-Code' (Sterility). PDP relies on 'Gen-Z Pop' (Dopamine). You are selling a clinical tool on one channel and candy on the other.
truth_2.evidence: WWW: 'Clean white background... Grid layout' vs. PDP: 'Vibrant pink jelly... Glowing model'
truth_2.why_matters: Visual physics matter. The 'Jelly' texture promises fun, but the website grid imposes discipline. The brand feels bipolar.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: The website feels cold and corrective; Amazon feels warm and addictive. Users migrating from a viral TikTok (Pink) to your site (White) feel the temperature drop and lose the impulse to buy. You must decide: either sterilize the Amazon listing to reflect R&D purity (Option A), or inject the 'Jelly Dopamine' visual language into the website to sustain the viral energy (Option B). Science is respectable, but dopamine sells.

truth_3.headline: The System vs. The Ingredient
truth_3.gap_description: WWW acts as 'The Tech Engineer,' selling complex device synergy. PDP acts as 'The Ingredient King,' aggressively selling the word 'Collagen.'
truth_3.evidence: WWW: 'Booster Pro... Air Shot Mode' vs. PDP: 'Collagen + Soluble Collagen... Triple Collagen'
truth_3.why_matters: The USP drift dilutes your ownership. Are you the 'Device Brand' or the 'Collagen Brand'? You can't own both mental slots.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: Your website assumes the user is an engineer who wants a 'System,' while your Amazon listing assumes they are a magpie looking for the 'Ingredient of the Month.' This disconnect creates friction. You must choose: either force Amazon shoppers to understand the complex 'Device Synergy' (Option A), or simplify the Website proposition to own the 'Collagen' category leadership (Option B). Complexity is the enemy of conversion.

truth_4.headline: The Safety Trap
truth_4.gap_description: Both channels rely heavily on 'The Safe Choice' territory (90% alignment). You use herd immunity (reviews/sales) to validate the purchase.
truth_4.why_matters: Relying on social proof ('Everyone buys it') works, but it implies the product is a commodity. If the trend dies, the brand authority evaporates.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: You are currently winning by being the 'Safe Bet' in K-Beauty. But safety is a commodity position; it works until something 'Safer' or 'Cooler' arrives. You face a strategic choice: continue to rely on 'Best Seller' badges which requires constant volume (Option A), or start building a deeper emotional loyalty that survives a sales dip (Option B). A brand built on volume dies by volume.

truth_5.headline: The Joy of Jelly
truth_5.gap_description: Both score high on Intelligence (90%), but PDP delivers higher emotional heat ('Delight'). The Amazon listing leans into the sensory joy of the 'Jelly' texture, while the site remains conservative.
truth_5.why_matters: The PDP proves that the 'Pink/Jelly' aspect is a massive conversion driver. Your website treats it as a side effect rather than the main event.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: Your website is whispering 'Contentment' (Safe), while your Amazon listing is screaming 'Delight' (Fun)—and the fun is converting 1 jar every minute. The 'Pink' sensory experience is your untapped weapon on the DTC site. You must decide: either tone down the 'Delight' on Amazon to ensure the purchase feels like a serious medical decision (Option A), or warm up the Website to ensure the medical decision feels like a reward (Option B). Joy is a better retention tool than relief.

marker_1.so_what: Both channels agree that science is the means to an aesthetic end (Glow).

marker_2.so_what: High alignment on democratizing professional results for the masses.

marker_3.so_what: Both channels prioritize performance data and transparent ingredient lists.

marker_4.so_what: WWW looks like a pharmacy (Uniform); PDP looks like a luxury upgrade (Status).

marker_5.so_what: WWW is a polite 'Reliable Expert'; PDP is a hyping 'Trendsetter'.

marker_6.so_what: PDP leans into 'The Lover' (Sensual/Pink), while WWW represses it for 'The Sage'.

marker_7.so_what: WWW is a 'Gentle Guide'; PDP is a screaming 'Hype Beast'.

marker_8.so_what: WWW is sterile white grids; PDP is chaotic pink energy.

marker_9.so_what: Both sell specific functional problems (Elasticity/Glow) using rational logic.

marker_10.so_what: The story consistently stars the 'Institute' and 'Labs' rather than a founder.

marker_11.so_what: WWW relies on 'Dermatologist Tested' (The Board); PDP relies on '2.5M Sold' (The Fans).

marker_12.so_what: WWW sells a complex 'Device Synergy' system; PDP just sells 'Collagen'.

marker_13.so_what: WWW tries to educate the user on mechanism; PDP just screams 'Buy Now'.

marker_14.so_what: WWW is more aggressive about 'Fixing' the skin than the PDP's 'Maintenance' approach.

marker_15.so_what: Both make the user feel smart (Savvy), but PDP adds a layer of sensory 'Delight'.

marker_16.so_what: Both channels position the product as a 'Trending' statement piece.

marker_17.so_what: Both leverage 'Herd Safety' (Reviews/Sales) to reduce purchase risk.
